bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of lou 瘺 , fistula, with a swelling developing in the neck or in the armpits resembling a scorpion. This is associated with fever and an aversion to cold. When they open to fester they develop into fistula. This is a chronic disease that fails to heal. Within the sores small bugs/worms resembling scorpions are seen to grow. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 34: 蠍瘺候，此由飲食居處有蠍蟲毒氣，入於腑臟，流於 經脈所生也。或生掖下，或生頸邊，腫起如蠍蟲之形，寒熱而潰成瘺。 久則瘡裏生細蠍蟲也 , “The signs of scorpion fistula : This is because [the patient] has encountered the poisonous qi of scorpions in beverages and food and at his domicile. It enters the palaces and depots and flows into the conduit vessels. It may effuse into the armpits or to the side of his neck. The swelling looks like a scorpion. [Patients] experience alternating sensations of cold and heat. Eventually it festers and develops into fistula. After a long time small scorpions grow in the sores”.
